intro: Amsinckiopsis, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of a single species, Amsinckiopsis calycina, which is native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, leathery leaves and its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Amsinckiopsis is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
